title: What are the most important ideas in Heidegger's philosophy related to technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: The central distinction Heidegger makes concerning technology is that the Being of technology is, in it’s being, is a collapsing of distance. In other words the more technological something is the faster, the easier, the closer…etc. Heidegger warned that the danger is that Being conceals itself in it’s nearness. Thus the more technological we are the more the Being of our being is concealed and forgotten in it’s nearness. He referred to our age technology as a “dark time”. A dark time, according to Heidegger, is not a time in which people are saying to themselves “this is a dark time”. Rather the very darkness lay in that no one is noticing the darkness. In other words the darkness is “in the dark”.

In “The Question Concerning Technology” he says that the reduction of distances brings us no closer to things. He is partly reflecting on the failure of both the Americans and the Nazis to use technology to help people. His only comment on the Holocaust was toward the end of his life, when he said that agriculture and the gas chambers are two parts of the same system. In other words, because modern agriculture relies on a massive amount of wealth held in reserve, a massive amount of waste is also produced, for the purpose of driving profits. This is also true in economics (standing reserve of labor) and in nuclear strategy. The Jews killed by the policies of bureaucrats like Heidegger and Goebbels represented this portion of “reserve” to the state, just like the leftover food thrown away by restaurants and farms as an everyday part of capitalism. Many commentators saw this comment of Heidegger’s, made in Der Spiegel around 1976, to be a cowardly shifting of blame away from himself, but it is consistent with his career-long condemnation of Bestand (reserve as fiscal policy). Another example of the use of reserve, described by François Ewald, a French Heideggerian, is the policy of mandatory insurance, as with auto insurance. This decreases the need for personal care and responsibility, because it makes an automatic accommodation for accidents.
